summary:
The Victorian Era in the United Kingdom lasted from 1837 to 1901, during Queen Victoria's reign. It was a time of big changes, with more people getting the right to vote and many political reforms. The British Empire grew stronger and had peaceful relations with other powerful countries.

In Britain, people cared a lot about good behavior and morality. This led to social improvements but also limited some people's freedom. The country became wealthier, but poor living conditions and diseases were still common. Education and literacy got better, especially for children. This era also saw lots of scientific and technological advancements, especially in industry and engineering.
title: Victorian era
